required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Tests: Nasopharyngeal Swab vs Saliva Collected With Salivette® Cortisol for Viral RNA Sampling for RT-qPCR
clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 Tests: a Systematic Comparison of Viral RNA Test Sample Taking for RT-qPCR, in This Case With a Nasopharyngeal Swab or Saliva Collected With Salivette® Cortisol, to Diagnose SARS-CoV-2 Virus Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the tests is to establish saliva collection with Salivette® Cortisol.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2-RNA detectability in Swab and Salivette samples.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Testing Positive or Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Mexico
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (the test day), up to one day.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants testing positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from sample collected via swab versus saliva sample collected from Salivette® Cortisol, which samples were processed in Mexico.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Testing True Positive or True Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Germany
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (the test day), up to one day.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants testing true positive or true negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from Swab and Saliva samples being processed in Germany was reported. The swab sample was used as the reference. Among participants who were tested positive from swab samples, those who were tested positive from saliva samples were classified as "true positive". Among participants tested negative from swab samples, those who were tested negative from saliva samples were then classified as "true negative".

intervention.intervention_name: Sampling of SARS-CoV-2 RNA from nasopharyngeal swab specimen or saliva collected via Salivette Cortisol
intervention.description: Kylt® for detection/confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 cobas® SARS-CoV-2 (PCR) test TaqPath™ COVID-19 CE-IVD RT-PCR kit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Informed consent form signed and dated before any samples have been taken.
2. Suspected or confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection by PCR within the past five days.
3. Male and/or female patients aged 18 years and over.

facility.name: Instituto Nacional de Enfermedades Respiratorias Ismael Cosío Villegas

link.description: Click here to connect to Boehringer Ingelheim Clinical Studies Website

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study compared the viral Ribonucleic acid (RNA) test sample taken for Quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-qPCR) via a nasopharyngeal swab versus saliva collected with Salivette® Cortisol in the diagnosing of SARS-CoV-2 virus infection.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were screened for eligibility prior to participation in the trial. Subjects attended a specialist site which ensured that they (the subjects) strictly met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria.

group.title: Overall
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Two samples were taken by medical staff from each participant on the test day, one using a swab (oropharyngeal swab) and the other through saliva collected with Salivette® Cortisol. The collected samples were then shipped and analyzed in Germany. Additional up to two samples (swab and/or saliva) were taken for each participant on the test day and analyzed in Mexico.

baseline.population: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry.

group.title: Overall
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Two samples were taken by medical staff from each participant on the test day, one using a swab (oropharyngeal swab) and the other through saliva collected with Salivette® Cortisol. The collected samples were then shipped and analyzed in Germany. Additional up to two samples (swab and/or saliva) were taken for each participant on the test day and analyzed in Mexico.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Testing Positive or Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Mexico
outcome.description: Number of participants testing positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from sample collected via swab versus saliva sample collected from Salivette® Cortisol, which samples were processed in Mexico.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (the test day), up to one day.
outcome.population: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry, and whose samples were processed in Mexico.

group.title: Swab - Processed in Mexico
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Additional up to two samples (swab and/or saliva) were taken for each participant on the test day and analyzed in Mexico. Participants whose swab samples were processed in Mexico and had non-missing results were included in this group.

group.title: Saliva - Processed in Mexico
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Additional up to two samples (swab and/or saliva) were taken for each participant on the test day and analyzed in Mexico. Participants whose saliva samples collected via Salivette® Cortisol were processed in Mexico and had non-missing results were included in this group.

measure.title: Number of Participants Testing Positive or Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Mexico
measure.description: Number of participants testing positive or negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from sample collected via swab versus saliva sample collected from Salivette® Cortisol, which samples were processed in Mexico.
measure.population: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry, and whose samples were processed in Mexico.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Testing True Positive or True Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Germany
outcome.description: Percentage of participants testing true positive or true negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from Swab and Saliva samples being processed in Germany was reported. The swab sample was used as the reference. Among participants who were tested positive from swab samples, those who were tested positive from saliva samples were classified as "true positive". Among participants tested negative from swab samples, those who were tested negative from saliva samples were then classified as "true negative".
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (the test day), up to one day.
outcome.population: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry, and had both swab and saliva sample that were processed in Germany.

group.title: Swab+Saliva - Processed in Germany
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Two samples were taken by medical staff from each participant on the test day, one using a swab (oropharyngeal swab) and the other through saliva collected with Salivette® Cortisol. The collected samples were then shipped and analyzed in Germany. Participants with both swab and saliva samples and whose samples were processed in Germany and had non-missing results were included in this group.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Testing True Positive or True Negative for SARS-CoV-2 Virus From Swab and Saliva Samples - Processed in Germany
measure.description: Percentage of participants testing true positive or true negative for SARS-CoV-2 virus from Swab and Saliva samples being processed in Germany was reported. The swab sample was used as the reference. Among participants who were tested positive from swab samples, those who were tested positive from saliva samples were classified as "true positive". Among participants tested negative from swab samples, those who were tested negative from saliva samples were then classified as "true negative".
measure.population: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry, and had both swab and saliva sample that were processed in Germany.

reported_events.desc: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry.

group.title: Overall
group.description: All eligible participants in this study who had been diagnosed with COVID-19 confirmed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test within the past 5 days before study entry. Two samples were taken by medical staff from each participant on the test day, one using a swab (oropharyngeal swab) and the other through saliva collected with Salivette® Cortisol. The collected samples were then shipped and analyzed in Germany. Additional up to two samples (swab and/or saliva) were taken for each participant on the test day and analyzed in Mexico.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.
